refnamediv.refpurpose: tell how long the system has been running

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Print the current time, the length of time the system has been up, the number of users on the system, and the average number of jobs in the run queue over the last 1, 5 and 15 minutes. Processes in an uninterruptible sleep state also contribute to the load average. If FILE is not specified, use /var/run/utmp. /var/log/wtmp as FILE is common.

listitem.para: GNU coreutils online help: <http://www.gnu.org/software/coreutils/> Report uptime translation bugs to <http://translationproject.org/team/>

refsect1.title: AUTHOR
refsect1.para: Written by Joseph Arceneaux, David MacKenzie, and Kaveh Ghazi.

refsect1.title: SEE ALSO
refsect1.para: The full documentation for uptime is maintained as a Texinfo manual. If the info and uptime programs are properly installed at your site, the command
should give you access to the complete manual.
